author: 4quarks
body:
#### PR description:
We propose an increase in the verbosity of XrdAdaptor logs. This was a long-standing request from site administrators and operators. This enhancement should allow us to have more information about redirects (endpoint, port, authentication protocol, IP version). We will therefore have a better ability to track the footprint of data-accesses within the federation. 

i.e. 
```
-------------------------------
Traceroute:
1. ||  cms-xrd-global02.cern.ch / IPv6 / [2001:1458:d00:2f::100:326] / 1094 / no auth / load balancer ||
2. ||  xrootd01.grid.hep.ph.ic.ac.uk / IPv6 / [2a0c:5bc0:c8:2:216:3eff:fe7f:189] / 1094 / no auth / endpoint ||
3. ||  cms-aaa-manager01.gridpp.rl.ac.uk / IPv6 / [2001:630:58:1800::82f6:b768] / 1094 / no auth / endpoint ||
4. ||  ceph-gw10.gridpp.rl.ac.uk / IPv6 / [2001:630:58:1820::82f6:b01d] / 1094 / gsi / endpoint ||
-------------------------------
%MSG
%MSG-i XrdAdaptorLvl1:  (NoModuleName) 28-Jun-2022 10:12:57 CEST pre-events
Serving data from:    [1] ceph-gw11.gridpp.rl.ac.uk   [2] ceph-gw10.gridpp.rl.ac.uk
%MSG
%MSG-i XrdAdaptorLvl3:  (NoModuleName) 28-Jun-2022 10:12:57 CEST pre-events
The quality of the active sources is:    [1] 140 for ceph-gw11.gridpp.rl.ac.uk   [2] 260 for ceph-gw10.gridpp.rl.ac.uk
```

#### PR validation:
As the changes only add extra verbosity on the logging they should not affect the current workflow.
title: Xrdadaptor logging
